_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing
All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a) The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:    

Third Coast Terminals (TCT) is deeply committed to the prevention of environmental pollution, conservation of resources and to observe all applicable legal and moral requirements that apply to all our work operations. Third Coast Terminals (TCT) has implemented policies and procedures at the Pearland facility with a commitment for accident prevention and safety.  TCT provides safety rules, practices, and procedures to help prevent accidents and to respond to incidents.  TCT strives for a record of zero accidents.



(b) The stationary source and regulated substances handled:

Third Coast Terminals (TCT) is a specialized storage, toll processing, contract blending and drumming operation serving the Global Petrochemical Industry.  TCT handles two different toxic chemicals above threshold values for the RMP program.  TCT handles Toluene Diisocyanate mixed isomers in storage tanks, and in bulk shipping containers.  TCT handles Formaldehyde in mixture with methanol in bulk shipping containers.



(c) The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

Third Coast Terminals has implemented the aspects of the EPA RMP program level 2 for Toluene Diisocyanates.  The systems in place include specific batch process procedures, transfer procedures, and storage monitoring programs.  Only trained employees are allowed to operate Toluene Diisocyanate equipment.  Formaldehyde is handled in solution with methanol and is only stored on the Third Coast Terminal property for short periods of time.  The process that utilizes formaldehyde has implemented all aspects of the OSHA PSM and EPA RMP program elements.  The system has specific procedures, maintenance checks, and requires dedicated personnel to monitor the equipment while formaldehyde is present.



(d) The five-year accident history:

Third Coast Terminals (TCT) has not had an accidental releas

e of Toluene Diisocyanate mixed isomers nor Formaldehyde in the last five years greater than the reportable quantity.



(e) The emergency response program: 

Third Coast Terminals (TCT) has established mutual aid system of emergency response that is coordinated with local and county emergency response agencies.  On-site personnel are trained to identify emergency situations, respond to specific emergencies within their personal training level, and implement the emergency action plan for response, if required.  TCT has prepared our organization for rapid response, recuperation, community assistance, and business continuity.



(f) Planned changes to improve safety:    

Through the TCT ongoing implementation of the OSHA PSM and EPA RMP programs, TCT looks continuously for possible system changes to improve safety at the facility.
